intro: Calydermos peduncularis, commonly known as the clustered calyx plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its clustered inflorescences and showy, pink to purple flowers. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
